Paola Maura Tricarico

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/6116608293120973
  • Última atualização do currículo em 01/12/2015

Possui graduação (BSC) em Ciencias Biologicas - Universidade de Bologna (Italia) (2010) e Mestrado em genomica Funcional - Universita' degli Studi di Trieste (Italia) (2012). Atualmente é aluna de Doutorado (data marcada para defesa 15 março 2016) - no "Department of Medical, Surgical and Health Sciences," da Universidade de Trieste (Italia). Tem experiência na área de Bioquímica, com ênfase em Biologia Molecular e Celular, tem tambem experiencia de Genetica Molecular. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2012 - 2014
Search functional and genetic defects in patients with inflammatory bowel disease (M.I.C.I.)
Descrição: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is a group of chronic multifactorial disorders. IBD encompasses a continuum of clinical disorders, ranging from Crohn s disease (CD) through indeterminate colitis (IC) to ulcerative colitis (UC). Although genetic factors have been associated with different forms of IBD, the diagnosis in each subject is commonly based on clinical and histopathology data, rather than genetic results. Indeed, the particular profile of common genetic variants has little consequences on the prediction of the disease course and response to treatments. Genome wide screening looking for genetic factors involved in the insurgence of pediatric IBDs. The main goal of the project is the identification of candidate genes associated with Early Onset or Very Early Onset IBDs. Identification of common inflammatory pathways shared by MICI patients with other auto inflammatory diseases. .
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Paola Maura Tricarico - Integrante / GIRARDELLI, MARTINA - Integrante / VUCH, JOSEF - Integrante / CROVELLA, S - Coordenador / BIANCO, ANNA MONICA - Integrante.
2012 - Atual
Inflammatory and neurological phenotype in the Mevalonate Kinase Deficiency (MKD): a pathogenic study and identification of new therapies
Descrição: Mevalonic aciduria (OMIM #610377, MA) is a rare, autosomal recessive, metabolic disease, linked to mutations in a key gene (mevalonate kinase, MVK) of the mevalonate pathway. MA is the most severe form of Mevalonate Kinase Deficiency (OMIM #260920, MKD), a periodic fever syndrome characterized by recurrent inflammatory attacks with fever, arthralgia, abdominal pain and diarrhoea in early in infancy. MA is considered an orphan disease, and indeed an etiologic treatment is still unavailable.  In recent years several candidate molecules have been identified that target the mevalonate pathway and are able to partially rescue the inflammatory process. However, the specific molecular events that lead to neurological impairment in MA are still unknown.  Our project aims at clarifying the pathogenesis of the disease and at discovering new therapeutic targets to counteract neuro-inflammation. -Development of MA in vitro models in neuronal and glial cell lines: biochemical model (obteined with use of inhibitors of cholesterol pathway) and transient genetic model (obtained with the use of pCMV-6, which encodes MVK with different mutations). -Molecular characterization of the mevalonate pathway block. Study the expression of inflammatory genes that may be involved in the activation of inflammatory process. -Characterization of the cellular response. Study of cell death (apoptosis, pyroptosis and necrosis), mitochondrial damage (oxidative stress) and autophagic flux. We demonstrated that in a biochemical and genetic cellular MA-model, the block of the mevalonate pathway is able to trigger intrinsic-apoptosis due to mitochondrial damage and inflammasome activation; all these events seem to be due to the autophagy and mitophagy block. The identification of key molecules involved in the aetiopathogenesis of MA should allow us to acquire new targets for potential therapeutic compounds. Our project aims at developing novel therapies capable of targeting both the metabolic and the immune MA-associated defects. Since MA is an orphan disease the final aim of the project is to develop novel therapeutic strategies to successfully tackle the disease..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Paola Maura Tricarico - Integrante / Sergio Crovella - Coordenador / Fulvio Celsi - Integrante / KLEINER, G - Integrante.
2012 - Atual
Mevalonate Kinase Deficiency: Optimization of diagnosis, study of the pathogenesis, search for new therapeutic approaches.
Descrição: Mevalonate Kinase Deficiency (OMIM #260920, MKD) is an autosomal recessive genetic disorder caused by mutations in MVK gene resulting in a decreased function of mevalonate kinase enzyme (MK), the second enzyme of cholesterol and isoprenoid pathway. MKD present different degrees of severity, associated with the residual enzyme mk, ranging from auto-inflammatory syndrome, to the more serious form, known as Mevalonic Aciduria (OMIM #610377, MA). Our study aims to investigate the pathogenesis of the disease thanks to the support of animal and cellular models. -In vitro studies using primary cell cultures and monocytic and neuronals cell lines treated with inhibitors of cholesterol pathway (MKD in vitro biochemical model). -Characterization of the cellular response to pathway inhibition. Research of exogenous compounds able to restore this metabolic block. Molecular characterization of the mevalonate pathway block. Study the expression of inflammatory genes that may be involved in the activation of inflammatory process induced by the lack of isoprenoid compouds. -Study of inherited defect of mevalonate kinase in Balb / c mice. Use statins and bisphosphonates as inhibitors of the mevalonate pathway to obtain a inflammatory phenotype characteristic of human disease..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Paola Maura Tricarico - Integrante / Sergio Crovella - Coordenador / Fulvio Celsi - Integrante / Martina Girardelli - Integrante.
